title: 108_s1853
content: The "Unemployment Compensation Extension Act" includes provisions for temporary extended unemployment compensation and a temporary increase in extended benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act provides for temporary extended unemployment compensation and a temporary increase in extended benefits under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The act includes references to the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 and extends the program for six months. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act allows for temporary extended unemployment compensation to continue until July 1, 2004, with a transition period for individuals receiving benefits. No compensation will be payable after December 31, 2004. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act allows for temporary extended unemployment compensation to continue until July 1, 2004, with a transition period for individuals receiving benefits. No compensation will be payable after December 31, 2004, with the effect as if included in the enactment of the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. SEC. 103. ENTITLEMENT TO ADDITIONAL WEEKS OF TEMPORARY EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION. The amendment increases the number of weeks for Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation (TEUC) and TEUC-X benefits. The TEUC amount is now 26 times the individual's weekly benefit amount, while the TEUC-X amount is 7 times the weekly benefit amount. These changes are effective retroactively to the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 has been amended to increase the number of weeks for TEUC and TEUC-X benefits. The TEUC amount is now 26 times the weekly benefit amount, while the TEUC-X amount is 7 times the weekly benefit amount. These changes apply to weeks of unemployment starting after the enactment of the Act. The Act increases TEUC and TEUC-X benefits. Determinations under section 203(c) are disregarded before the amendments. New determinations are made under amended section 203(c). The Act increases TEUC and TEUC-X benefits, with determinations made under amended section 203(c) to ensure exhaustion of accounts. If an individual's account was augmented and exhausted of all TEUC-X amounts before the Act's enactment, exhaustion is determined as of that date. SEC. 104. TEUC-X TRIGGER FIX. Amends section 203(c)(2)(B) to adjust the period for unemployment benefits in certain states under the Act. TEMPORARY INCREASE IN EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS UNDER THE RAILROAD UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE ACT. Temporary increase in extended unemployment benefits for employees with 10 or more years of service under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The text chunk discusses the application of extended unemployment benefits for employees with less than 10 years of service under the Railroad Unemployment Insurance Act. The provisions of extended unemployment benefits apply to employees who received normal benefits under the Act between July 1, 2002, and July 1, 2004.
